title.narrative: Conservation of Museum Objects and Collections Damaged during Hurricane Dorian

description.narrative: Hurricane Dorian, which hit The Bahamas in early September 2019, was the countrys most intense tropical cyclone on record and the largest natural disaster in its history. This project involves the procurement and delivery of emergency conservation supplies for local museums and other collecting institutions on Abaco and other impacted islands.

title.narrative: Restoration of the 19th-Century Elbow Reef Lighthouse in the Abaco Islands

description.narrative: The Elbow Reef Lighthouse is the last remaining hand-operated, kerosene-powered lighthouse in the world. This project involves the restoration of the tower and lantern which were damaged during Hurricane Dorian in September 2019.
